techmeme.title: PayPal hires one of Walmart's top tech executives Srini Venkatesan as its CTO, effective June 24, replacing Archie Deskus, who will leave the company in July (Hannah Lang/Reuters)
Meta rolls out the ability for users to restrict their Instagram Lives to Close Friends, with the option for three other users to join the broadcast (Kris Holt/Engadget)
LA-based GrayMatter Robotics, which develops AI-powered robotic cells for the manufacturing industry, raised a $45M Series B led by Wellington Management (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
Gynger, which lets companies "finance, pay, and manage" their tech purchases, raised a $20M Series A led by PayPal Ventures, bringing its total raised to $31.7M (Mary Ann Azevedo/TechCrunch)
Anthropic debuts Artifacts, which lets users see and interact with the results from Claude requests, signaling its long-term vision for companies to use Claude (David Pierce/The Verge)
